titleStmt.title: The young mans joys compleated. Or, The coy damsel conquered by his pure love and loyalty. She first deny'd to be his bride, least he should prove unjust; but when she knew his love was true she set his heart at rest. To the tune of, O so ungrateful a creature. This may be printed. R.P.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J[osiah]. Blare, at the Looking-Glass on London-Bridge.,

notesStmt.note: Verse - "Now to my true lover Betty,".
Date, place of publication and publisher's name from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
